page.title: 08ECOLOGY
page.content: There is not very much pollution in our region, although farmers are concerned about the effects of chemicals on the wildlife. Many are conservationists. In our region we have a lot of pheasants, deer, squirrels,rabbits and animals like that. Foxes and badgers make their homes in nearby woodland. We have not very many footpaths and those we have are unmarked.There are a few bridle paths. The edges of fields and roadsides have an abundance of wildflowers giving colour for much of the year, from snowdrops in early spring to daffodils, bluebells, speedwell, poppies and foxgloves of the summer. Summer weather is variable. Winter can on occasion be more severe, cutting off more isolated areas and farms.
